2,3,4,5:
wish引起的虚拟语气, 注意不是was而是were

I were I were still in high school.

2,3:
finish school
完成学业

I want to finish school before I get married.

6,7,8:
on one's own
独自一人

I'm not going to be your partner any more so you're on your own.
4,5:
pretty much
差不多

-How far do we still need to go?
-We are actually pretty much there.

5:
internship
实习

He did his internship at Garfield Hospital.

cheerful 
adj. 高兴的,振奋的

The news isn't very cheerful, I'm afraid.

9,10,11:
student loans
学生贷款, 上学的贷款

Did you go to college on student loans?
7,8:
pay off
还清债务

I'll be able to pay off all my debt by end of this year.

3,4,5:
can't afford to do
无法承担...的费用

I am not a millionaire. I can't afford to buy you a new car.

4,5:
newspaper headline
报纸头条

The news of his death was splashed in newspaper headlines across all the newspapers.

4:
subsidize 
v. 资助

You can't expect government to subsidize your college educaiton.

3:
benefit 
n. 工作的额外补助, 比如一周工作4天, 每天有免费水果等.

This job doesn't pay much but it has many benefits.

qualification n.
[ˌkwɑlɪfɪ'keɪʃn]
资格资历

You'll never get a good job if you don't have any qualifications.
